title: Computer-Assisted Language Learning (CALL)-Based Curriculum for Second Language Word Recognition and Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: The learner is a high school student in their teens performing administrative/management tasks, learning in a limited technological environment using smartphones. The curriculum is designed around job-related vocabulary linked to social studies.

learning_goals: Participants can recognize words heard in a second language with over 80% accuracy.
Participants can complete tasks reconstructing listened-to words into text using smartphone-based CALL tools, achieving at least three levels of improved accuracy.
Participants can achieve a score improvement of over 20% in post-training academic vocabulary tests compared to pre-training assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
